Package edu.missouri.drone

Class DroneUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mmkrusniak.drone.DroneUtil
  • public class DroneUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a variety of useful functionality for creating new drone path algorithms.

        public static double getScanWidth​(double alt)
        Yields the apparent width (in meters) of an image taken at the given altitude.
        Parameters:
        alt - An altitude, in meters.
        Returns:
        The apparent width (in meters) of an image taken at the given altitude.

      • getScanHeight

        public static double getScanHeight​(double alt)
        Yields the apparent height (in meters) of an image taken at the given altitude. (Note that height refers to distance on the y-axis, while altitude refers to distance on the z axis.)
        Parameters:
        alt - An altitude, in meters.
        Returns:
        The apparent height (in meters) of an image taken at the given altitude.

      • getScanAlt

        public static double getScanAlt​(double height)
        Yields the required altitude (in meters) for an image taken at that altitude to have the given apparent height.
        Parameters:
        height - A (y-axis) apparent image height, in meters.
        Returns:
        The altitude required to yield an image of that apparent height, in meters.

      • subdivide

        public static java.util.List<Point> subdivide​(java.util.List<Point> points,
                                              double alt)
        Divides a list of points which is taken to describe a drone path into a denser list, where points are placed on the path in regular intervals such that images taken at those points at the given altitude line up perfectly (when their smaller dimension is parallel to the path).
        Parameters:
        points - A list of points to be considered as a drone path.
        alt - A drone altitude.
        Returns:
        A denser list of points such that images taken at each point perfectly line up.

      • plow

        public static java.util.List<Point> plow​(Polygon poly,
                                         Point start,
                                         double alt)
        Gives a simple back-and-forth plow path through the given polygon from the start point at a certain altitude.
        Parameters:
        poly - An area through which to plow.
        start - A starting location.
        alt - An altitude at which to cover the area.
        Returns:
        A simple plow coverage path through the polygon, as a list of points.

      • plow

        public static java.util.List<Point> plow​(Polygon poly,
                                         Point current,
                                         double alt,
                                         double theta)
        Gives a simple back-and-forth plow path through the given polygon from the start point at a certain altitude which will occur at an angle to the polygon.
        Parameters:
        poly - An area through which to plow.
        current - A starting location.
        theta - An angle at which to do the plow motion
        alt - An altitude at which to cover the area.
        Returns:
        A simple plow coverage path through the polygon, as a list of points.

      • optimizePlan

        public static java.util.List<Route> optimizePlan​(java.util.List<Point> plan)
        Optimizes a drone plan which is given as a list of points. This generates routes through points which are lined up (so the drone doesn't stop at each one individually) and routes directly to points which are not (to prevent overshooting). The first and last two points are always direct routes.
        Parameters:
        plan - A drone plan, given as a list of points.
        Returns:
        An optimized drone plan, given as a list of Routes.

      • optimizeRoutes

        public static java.util.List<Route> optimizeRoutes​(java.util.List<Route> plan)
        Optimizes a drone plan which is given as a list of routes. This sets the appropriate routes to be RoutesTo and RoutesThrough, and leaves heading changes as-is. Analogous to optimizePlan. This is useful if you are creating a drone based on anothers' already-optimized routes with small changes, so you can easily re-optimize it after the changes.
        Parameters:
        plan - A drone plan given as a list of Routes.
        Returns:
        An optimized drone plan as a list of Routes.

      • rotatePath

        public static java.util.List<Point> rotatePath​(java.util.List<Point> points,
                                               double theta,
                                               Point c)
        Rotates an entire path (as a list of points) about a point.
        Parameters:
        points - A path to rotate, as a list of points.
        theta - An amount by which to rotate the path.
        c - A point about which to rotate the path.
        Returns:
        The input path, rotated by theta about the given point.

      • heuristicTSP

        public static java.util.List<Point> heuristicTSP​(java.util.List<? extends Point> points,
                                                 Point start,
                                                 Point end)
        Performs a simple heuristic TSP ordering on the given points. I'm not sure this is working as expected, as nothing seems to use the return value. Maybe this should be double-checked for functionality?
        Parameters:
        points - A set of points.
        start - A starting point.
        end - An ending point.
        Returns:
        A slightly more ordered set of points.

        Returns:

        Returns:
